Job Description
Position Purpose:

Provide financial reporting, valuation, business plan projection and analytical and business support to the actuarial department.

Nature and Scope of Responsibilities:

Financial Support & Reporting
  • Produce reliable actuarial reports using both internal and external databases on a scheduled and ad hoc basis including but not limited to:
  • Compliance Reporting
  • Management Reporting
  • Statutory Reporting
  • Assume a leading role in development, testing, and loading of the company-wide Data Warehouse.
  • Serve as a subject matter expert on functionality, content and data elements of data sources and reports.
  • Design, program, maintain, and produce ongoing production reports.
  • Improve and streamline the current reporting process and enhance reporting efficiency
  • Create controls to enhance data reconciliation, validations, and the peer review process.
  • Work with the IT Department and third party administrators on an ongoing basis to ensure quality data reporting.
  • Help bring the current statutory and compliance reporting process into compliance with the NAIC Model Audit Regulation
  • Other duties as assigned by the Chief Actuary
Support Corporate Actuarial Function
  • Assist with modeling required to support the Appointed Actuary’s annual statement of actuarial opinion and associated memorandum.
  • Update monthly and quarterly claims and premium reports to support valuation and assist in experience reporting.
  • Other duties as assigned by the Chief Actuary
Support the Group Segment Accounting Process
  • Assist with loading data into the accounting system tables, e.g. group investment allocation entries, group and corporate segment quarterly transfers
  • Other duties as assigned by the Chief Actuary
Qualifications / Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Math/Computer Science/Business or equivalent business experience. Actuarial Exams P, FM, M(LC) a plus, but not required.
  • 3-6 years of work experience in performing analytics in the Health Insurance Industry using claims, premium, and enrollment data.
  • At least 1-2 years of SQL server, query, and relational database design. Ability to work with Cubes a plus.
  • Excellent analytical/advanced level database and spreadsheet experience.
  • Excel, Access, and SQL a must, Visual Basic Applications a plus.
  • Proficiency in MS Office products (Word, PowerPoint & Outlook)
  • Ability to work independently; excellent problem solving skills.
  • Strong communication, time management, organization, and interpersonal skills


Competencies:
  • Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.
  • Judgment - Displays willingness to make decisions; Exhibits sound and accurate judgment; Supports and explains reasoning for decisions; Includes appropriate people in decision-making process; Makes timely decisions.
  • Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
  • Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data; Designs work flows and procedures.
